nVVG79pX.question: A reason that GPS satellites use helical antennae is

options.text: that the signal has a circular polarization.
to achieve better omni directional receiving qualities.
to improve the signal to noise ratio.
to neutralize the ionospheric delay.

XhlFjUZ1.question: You are flying along an airway which is 10 NM wide (5 NM either side of the centreline). The distance to the VOR/DME you are using is 100 NM. If you are on the airway boundary, how many dots deviation will the VOR needle show if one dot represents 2°?

BEz9MBmk.question: Which of the following will give the most accurate calculation of aircraft ground speed?

options.text: A DME station sited on the flight route
An ADF sited on the flight route
A DME station sited across the flight route
A VOR station sited on the flight route

GVA3bose.question: Which of the following will give the most accurate calculation of aircraft ground speed?

options.text: A DME station sited on the flight route.
An ADF sited on the flight route.
A VDF station sited across the flight route.
A VOR station sited on the flight route.

m1pgaaRh.question: At which position would an aircraft at an altitude of 5000 ft AMSL receive the strongest signal from VNC NDB (27°04.3’N, 082°26.4’W)?

options.text: two antennas: one for the transmission, and an other for the reception.
two antennas: one interrogates other aircraft transponders, and an other for the reception.
four antennas: two for the transmission, and two for the reception.
a single antenna for simultaneous transmission and reception.

IYtB9U1W.question: Which on-board sensor would typically be used to augment GNSS positional information as part of an Airborne-Based Augmentation System (ABAS)?

options.text: IRS
ADS-B
EGNOS
TCAS II

C2RNT8xn.question:
A GBAS system communicates with an aircraft using GPS to provide aircraft with information, including which of the following?
  1. Integrity information,
  2. Almanac data,
  3. Approach data,
  4. Receiver noise correction.

options.text: 1 and 3
1 and 4
2 and 4
2 and 3

4EKTsnEp.question: Which of the following is an advantage of GLS (GBAS Landing System) compared to ILS?

options.text: GLS allows for more precise navigation within the vicinity of the airfield.
Aircraft fitted with GPS receivers do NOT need any additional receivers for GBAS operation.
GLS approaches are approved for low visibility operations.
GLS approaches do NOT need to be published.

wWNaDFet.question: Which statement is true about the navigation data in the navigation message of GPS?

options.text: The navigation data are uploaded to the satellites by the GPS control segment.
The navigation data are checked and, if necessary, corrected by the satellite itself.
The navigation data are valid for a period of 28 days.
During normal operation, the navigation data of one satellite are checked by other satellites in the constellation and, if necessary, corrected.

YZpEKU3o.question: Which of the following is true for a Ground-Based Augmentation System (GBAS)?

options.text: Only one ground station is required to support an unlimited number of aircraft in its airspace in jurisdiction.
A minimum of two ground stations is required for transmission to arriving aircraft; one of them provides differential position corrections while the other one gives integrity data for each satellite.
At least two ground stations are required for each end of the runway.
It requires one ground station transmitting in the UHF range to supply error signals to all aircraft in the final approach segment.

wXjq9Z0f.question:
Which of the following is included in the navigation message of the GPS system: 
1. Almanac data 
2. Ephemeris data
3. Satellite clock correction parameters 
4. UTC parameters 
5. Ionospheric model 
6. Satellite health data

options.text: 1, 2 and 6
1, 2 and 3

Y3twmnOz.question: Which statement regarding GLONASS compared to NAVSTAR GPS is true?

options.text: GLONASS satellites orbit faster than NAVSTAR GPS satellites
GLONASS uses the same Earth-centred Earth-fixed datum as NAVSTAR GPS.
GLONASS uses the same UTC as NAVSTAR GPS.
GLONASS satellites circle in three polar orbits and NAVSTAR GPS satellites in six.

2Z7nr7hJ.question:
Which of the following statements are correct, with regard to the clocks in the satellites of the Galileo system?
1. There are 2 identical atomic clocks in each satellite both rubidium.
2.There are 2 different atomic clocks in each satellite; one rubidium and one passive hydrogen maser
3.One atomic clock is the master, the other is a slave.
4 The clocks are not synchronised with each other

options.text: Statements 2 and 4 are correct
Only statement 1 is correct
Statements 1 and 3 are correct
Only statement 2 is correct.

hw3FDKTk.question: You are flying in polar region, passing Svalbard, while your GPS becomes unserviceable. Which of the following devices can be used during in the meantime, when your aircraft is equipped with an autonomous integrity monitoring system (AAIM)?

options.text: IRS/INS and barometric altimeter
Directional gyro and magnetic compass
Ground transmitters if signals are received.
VOR and DME

l0GUEeXE.question: Which statement about GPS navigation is true?

options.text: The satellite clock error correction is important for accurate position fixing.
The Dilution of Precision (DOP) has to be more than level 6 for position fixing in en-route navigation.
The tropospheric delay is negligible when navigating in P-RNAV condition.
The combination of GPS and INS has no advantages.

ZuGOIS9V.question: A GPS-based SBAS uses satellites to transmit corrections to users. Which statement about these satellites is true?

options.text: Pseudo-range measurements to these geostationary satellites can be made as they also transmit a valid GPS navigation message on the GPS-frequency.
Pseudo-range measurements to these satellites can be made as they are actually GPS-satellites which are part of the GPS-satellite constellation.
Although they transmit the corrections on the GPS-frequency, pseudo-range measurements to these satellite cannot be made as they do not transmit a valid GPS navigation message.
Pseudo-range measurements to these geostationary satellites cannot be made as they transmit on a non-GPS-frequency and because they do not transmit a valid GPS navigation message.

DV22GI5C.question: With an GNSS ground-based augmentation system a correction is transmitted for...

options.text: tropospheric and ionospheric delays.
multipath errors and receiver errors.
ionospheric disturbances and receiver clock errors.
satellite clock errors and multipath errors on the VHF broadcast.

dc0PkbLD.question: Which of the following errors can be compensated for by a NAVSTAR/GPS receiver, receiving L1 & L2 transmissions?

options.text: Ionospheric
dilution of precision (DOP)
atmospheric
Both atmospheric and ionospheric

75f9jSn7.question: Why is the measured distance between a NAVSTAR/GPS satellite and a receiver called a pseudo-range?

options.text: The calculated range includes receiver clock error.
The measured distance is based on the pseudo random noise code.
The movement of the satellite and receiver during the distance calculation is excluded.
The calculated range is based on an idealised Keplerian orbit.

EmHcx2xm.question: Which statement from the choice below characterises a Satellite Based Augmentation System (SBAS)?

options.text: SBAS is able to provide approach and landing operations with vertical guidance.
The ground reference station transmits corrections directly to the user by VHF/UHF data-link.
The SBAS monitor stations send corrected positions to the users within the range of the station.
SBAS is an augmentation device for Ground Based Augmentation Systems.

A9ERictQ.question: Which statement about the pseudo-range corrections determined by a Satellite-Based Augmentation System (SBAS) is correct?

options.text: The pseudo-range correction for a certain satellite is split up into separate corrections for the ephemeris error, the satellite clock error and the ionospheric error.
In an SBAS the pseudo-range corrections are determined by geostationary satellites and sent to the users by a network of ground stations.
Each user receives only the pseudo-range corrections for the satellites that are visible for this user in order to keep the correction message as short as possible.
The pseudo-range corrections are determined by a station network on the ground and for all satellites the same correction is sent to the users.

VnpUY5qg.question: Which one of the following statements about EGNOS is correct?

options.text: EGNOS consists of 3 geostationary satellites which broadcast GPS look-alike signals in order to improve accuracy.
EGNOS is a local area augmentations system operation in North America.
With EGNOS installed in an aircraft, the GNSS-reciever can use satellites from all Global Navigation Satellite Systems in order to get better accuracy.
EGNOS can improve accuracy to 0,1 dm horizontally and 0,03 dm vertically.

fG5ocyBp.question: Which of the following systems are operational SBAS?

options.text: WAAS in the USA, MSAS in Japan, EGNOS in Europe, and GAGAN in India.
GPS in the USA, MSAS in Japan, Galileo in Europe, and GAGAN in India.
GPS in the USA, SDCM in Japan, EGNOS in Europe, and GAGAN in India.
WAAS in the USA, MSAS in Japan, EGNOS in Europe, and IRNSS in India.

G1GnByzd.question: With respect to the user equivalent range error and the satellite errors, which of the following is true?

options.text: Ionospheric effects are more significant than satellite clock errors.
Satellite clocks are so accurate that clock errors can practically be ignored.
The user equivalent range error is the difference between errors due to ionospheric effects and satellite clock errors.
Satellite clock errors are more significant than ionospheric effects.

U580yfBZ.question: A GNSS approach may achieve a lower minima by using a ground station to transmit correction signals for a small, defined geographical area (historically known as LAAS, Local Area Augmentation System). An example of such an approach is...

options.text: GLS approach (GBAS Landing System) to CAT I, II or III standard.
APV (Approach Procedure with Vertical guidance) to CAT I, II or III standard.
LNAV/VNAV approach procedure to CAT I, II or III standard.
ILS approach (Instrument Landing System) to CAT I, II or III standard.

r2LEIXZx.question: Which statement is correct about the SBAS (Satellite-Based Augmentation Systems)?

options.text: In an SBAS the pseudo range corrections are sent to the users by geostationary satellites
In an SBAS the pseudo range correction are sent to the users by the satellite of the satellite systems (e.g. by GPS satellites for GPS)
In an SBAS the pseudo range correction are determined by geostationary satellites and sent to the users by a network of ground stations
In an SBAS the pseudo range corrections are determined by geostationary satellites and sent to the users by the satellite of the satellite systems (e.g. by GPS satellites for GPS)

Q8uGaCql.question: Which statement is correct about the SBAS (Satellite-Based Augmentation Systems)?

options.text: In an SBAS the pseudo range corrections are sent to the users by geostationary satellites.
In an SBAS the pseudo range corrections are determined by geostationary satellites and sent to the users by the satellite of the satellite systems (e.g. by GPS satellites for GPS).
In an SBAS the pseudo range correction are sent to the users by the satellite of the satellite systems (e.g. by GPS satellites for GPS).
In an SBAS the pseudo range correction are determined by geostationary satellites and sent to the users by a network of ground stations.

YH2q6wsY.question: Which statement about a Satellite Based Augmentation System (SBAS) is correct?

options.text: SBAS is able to provide approach and landing operations with vertical guidance.
SBAS is able to provide approach and landing operations with horizontal guidance only.
SBAS is an augmentation device for Ground Based Augmentation Systems.
SBAS is able to provide guidance for precision approaches.

OTd0JAAc.question: Which statement about a Satellite Based Augmentation System (SBAS) is correct?

options.text: SBAS is able to provide approach and landing operations with vertical guidance.
SBAS is an augmentation device for Ground Based Augmentation Systems.
The ground reference station transmits corrections directly to the user via VHF/UHF data link.
The SBAS monitor stations send corrected positions to the users within the range of the station.

D0UpV9L0.question: Which statement about a Satellite Based Augmentation System (SBAS) is correct?

options.text: SBAS is able to provide guidance for precision approaches.
SBAS is an augmentation device for Ground Based Augmentation Systems.
SBAS is able to provide approach and landing operations with horizontal guidance only.
SBAS is able to provide approach and landing operations with vertical guidance only.

uMiDHfsH.question:
A GBAS system communicates with an aircraft using GPS to provide aircraft with information, including:1. Integrity information, 
 2. Almanac data, 
 3. Approach data, 
 4. Receiver noise correction.

options.text: 1 and 3
1 and 4
2 and 3
2 and 4

QmIoQM5G.question: Which of the following is true regarding SBAS?

options.text: Ground equipment transmits position corrections to GPS satellites.
SBAS is satellite based and does not use ground stations.
Satellites are calculating position corrections and transmit directly to aircraft within range.
SBAS is ground based and does not use satellites.

QP8TTIc3.question: Which of the following statements about the accuracy that can be obtained with the LAAS (local area augmentation system) of the satellite navigation system NAVSTAR GPS is correct?

options.text: The closer the receiver is to a LAAS ground reference station, the more accurate is the aircraft position fix.
A LAAS cannot correct for satellite timing and orbital position error.
A LAAS corrects the position of the aircraft by relaying the information via a geo-stationary satellite.
The increase in accuracy of position fixes is independent of the aircraft position in relation to the LAAS ground reference station.

hrfsHtGi.question: Which statement is correct about GLONASS/NAVSTAR GPS/GALILEO:

options.text: all three systems use time measurement to determine position.
for position fixing they are all based on the WGS84 ellipsoid.
they are all using the same frequencies to permit a single receiver to work all three systems.
they all reach their degree of accuracy in polar areas.

cd5Rm7eh.question: Which statement regarding GLONASS is correct?

options.text: GLONASS satellites orbit at a lower height than NAVSTAR GPS satellites.
The orbit time of GLONASS satellites is the same as that of NAVSTAR GPS satellites.
GLONASS satellites circle in three polar orbits.
The GLONASS satellite constellation consists of six orbital planes.

DCmxUexW.question:
Which of the following are contents of the navigation message from NAVSTAR/GPS? 
  
 1. Almanac data 
 2. Ephemeris 
 3. Satellite clock correction parameters 
 4. UTC parameters 
 5. Ionospheric model 
 6. Satellite health data

5CNclsnP.question: Which of the following correctly describes the principle of Reciever Autonomous Integrity Monitoring (RAIM)?

options.text: requires at least five satellites with good geometry to provide the service of detecting faulty signals and alerting the crew.
is guaranteed to be available for all scheduled flight operations at mid-latitudes.
is available if range from at least three satellites is supplemented by barometric aiding.
must be assured at all times in order to utilise Global Navigation Satellite System ( GNSS)signals in any augmentation system.

ar9JIcKK.question: A GPS satellite is marked unhealthy by:

options.text: the GPS control segment.
an independent international body controlling the functioning of GPS.
the GPS space segment.
the space division of the Department of Transportation of the USA.

MG5dsa4Z.question: A GPS receiver is able to calculate an aircraft’s groundspeed by measuring the...

options.text: Doppler shift of the satellite carrier frequency.
phase difference of the satellite signal and a receiver-generated signal.
travel time of the satellite signal between satellite and receiver.
phase of the received satellite signal.

0gbsD2Mm.question: Which of the following statements about SBAS/GBAS is true?

options.text: SBAS can cover more area than GBAS.
GBAS does not need satellite signals, SBAS does.
SBAS does not need ground stations, GBAS does.
GBAS can cover more area than SBAS.

xQdYCzS1.question: Which of the following combinations of satellite navigation systems provide the most accurate position fixes in air navigation?

options.text: NAVSTAR/GPS and GLONASS
GLONASS and COSPAS-SARSAT
NNSS-Transit and GLONASS
NAVSTAR/GPS and NNSS-Transit

okjZsNkb.question: A flight is planned to Longyear Airport in Svalbard (78°15'N). Due to the high latitude the aircraft GPS will NOT be able to achieve RAIM during the arrival phase, with too few satellites in view. If the aircraft is suitably equipped, which of the following could be used for integrity monitoring? AAIM means Aircraft Autonomous Integrity Monitoring.

options.text: AAIM using the IRS and barometric altimeter.
GBAS using the INS and barometric altimeter.
GBAS using the DME only.
AAIM using the VOR and DME

J9wgX8R6.question: Which of the following options correctly lists errors that affect the accuracy and reliability of the Satellite-Assisted Navigation system (GNSS/GPS)?

options.text: Satellite clock, satellite ephemeris, and ionospheric propagation.
Satellite mutual interference, satellite ephemeris, and atmospheric propagation.
Satellite to ground time lag, atmospheric propagation, and satellite clock.
Satellite mutual interference, frequency drift, and satellite to ground time lag.

yNLQ4zxt.question: Which of the following lists all the parameters that can be determined by a GPS receiver tracking signals from 4 different satellites?

options.text: Latitude, longitude, altitude and time
Latitude, longitude and time
Latitude, longitude and altitude
Latitude and longitude

m1ENqryd.question: Which of the following is an aircraft-based augmentation system (ABAS)?

options.text: RAIM
GPWS
GBAS
SBAS

XRSm0ozK.question: Which statement about the satellites (that transmit the corrections to the users) of a Satellite Based Augmentation System (SBAS) is correct?

options.text: These geostationary satellites can also be used as navigation satellites to which pseudo-ranges can be measured.

These satellites form a part of the constellation of the navigation satellites i.e. they have the same inclination and altitude but cannot be used as navigation satellites as they transmit the correction in a different frequency band.

These satellites form a part of the constellation of the navigation satellites i.e. they have the same inclination and altitude as these satellites and can be used as navigation satellites to which pseudo-ranges can be measured.
These satellites are geostationary and determine the corrections independently from a ground station network.

mWkTSBKk.question: Which of the following statements is correct concerning the principle behind the correction of one of the NAVSTAR GPS satellite navigation system errors by the transmission of the signals on two frequencies (L1 and L2)?

options.text: The path delay of the signals in the earth atmosphere is proportional to the inverse of the carrier frequency squared.
The influence of shadowing on the GPS signals is proportional to the inverse of the carrier frequency squared.
The effect of signal reflections (multipath effect) can be reduced due to the interference of both frequencies.
The effect of receiver noise can be reduced due to the interference of both frequencies.

yN1m4BT4.question: Which of the following statements about the accuracy that can be obtained with the differential technique (D-GPS) of the satellite navigation system NAVSTAR GPS is correct?

options.text: The nearer a receiver is situated to a D-GPS ground station, the more accurate the position fix.
Only D-GPS allows position fixes accurate enough for Non Precision Approaches.
A D-GPS receiver can detect and correct for SA providing a more accurate position fix.
The increase in accuracy of position fixes is independent of the receiver position in relation to a D-GPS ground station.

UB83uUIC.question: Which statement about dilution of precision is correct? The value of the dilution of precision depends upon the..

options.text: geometry and the number of satellites in view.
availability of aircraft-based augmentation systems.
accuracy with which the range between the satellite and receiver can be measured.
availability of receiver autonomous integrity monitoring software.

U4LmLJOk.question: A GPS satellite is considered unhealthy, when...

options.text: the satellite cannot transmit a navigation message.
it does not send any signal.
the satellites used for position determination are close to each other.
the position of a satellite is different from its intended position.

qLmMwcCP.question:
A RAIM system has excluded a satellite. 
How many satellites are required to maintain a 3D Position fix with RAIM capability?

JJd5soxv.question: Which statement correctly describes the principle of SBAS operation? A correction signal is broadcast from

options.text: geostationary satellites to GNSS receivers distributed over a wide area.
ground-based transmitters to GNSS receivers distributed over a wide area.
ground-based transmitters to GNSS receivers located in a small, local area.
geostationary satellites to GNSS receivers located in a small, local area.

SoYa3ntW.question: Which of the following correctly describes the principle of integrity monitoring within Airborne-Based Augmentation Systems (ABAS)? ABAS..

options.text: uses redundant range measurements to support Fault Detection (FD) or Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
requires a Satellite-Based Augmentation System (SBAS) to broadcast differential corrections and integrity messages.
uses ground-based radio navigation aids to support Fault Detection (FD) or Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
requires a Ground-Based Augmentation System (GBAS) to broadcast differential corrections and integrity messages.

erTWSso8.question: Which one of the following errors can be compensated for by a NAVSTAR/GPS receiver comparing L1 and L2 frequencies?

options.text: Ionospheric delay
Tropospheric
Receiver noise
Multipath

FoMNW1ze.question: Which of the following statements is correct with regard to aircraft autonomous integrity monitoring (AAIM)?

options.text: It has the capability to measure within the Aircraft systems the Fault Detection (FD) and Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
It has the capability to measure by the ground stations the Fault Detection (FD) and Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE)
It has the capability to measure within the aircraft systems and by the ground stations, the Fault Detection (FD) and Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
It does not have the capability to measure within the Aircraft systems the Fault Detection (FD) and Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).

ww3dgwqF.question: Which of the following statements is correct concerning the L1 and L2 NAVSTAR/GPS transmission frequencies and codes?

options.text: The higher frequency is used to transmit both the C/A and P codes.
C/A and P codes are transmitted at different times on both frequencies.
The higher frequency is only used to transmit the P code.
The lower frequency is used to transmit both the C/A and P codes.

nUkY49lg.question: Which of the following statements concerning the L1 and L2 NAVSTAR/GPS transmission frequencies and codes is correct?

options.text: The higher frequency is used to transmit both the C/A and P codes
C/A and P codes are transmitted at different times on both frequencies
The higher frequency is only used to transmit the P code
The lower frequency is used to transmit both the C/A and P codes

i7OLwkue.question: A NAVSTAR GPS satellite broadcasts on two frequencies. What is broadcast on both L1 and L2 frequencies?

options.text: Ranging signals
C/A code
RAIM code
SBAS signals

R3YnxPS1.question: Which statement is correct? NAVSTAR GPS and GLONASS use...

options.text: different data for navigation services but are interoperable.
different data for navigation services, and for this reason they are NOT interoperable.
the same data for navigation services, by agreement.
the same data for navigation services but are NOT interoperable.
Integrity of the GNSS navigation signals using only GPS signals or GPS signals augmented with altitude.
Aircraft's position in three dimensions from at least 4 available satellites and one on-board inertial system.
Accuracy of the computed aircraft position based on input from at least one ground-based radio transmitter.
Predicted positions of GNSS satellites to ensure that the required Geometric Dilution Of Precision (GDOP) will be available at all times.

iHMuh4EW.question: Which of the following is broadcast on both L1 and L2 frequencies?

options.text: Ranging signals.
SBAS.
C/A code.
RAIM.

dx77H5HU.question: Which of the following satellite navigation systems has Full Operational Capability (FOC) and is approved for specified flights under IFR conditions in Europe?

options.text: NAVSTAR GPS
NNSS/Transit
GLONASS
COSPAS-SARSAT

LeEaXtGO.question: Which of the following satellite navigation systems has Full Operational Capability (FOC) and is approved for specified flights under IFR conditions in Europe?

options.text: NAVSTAR/GPS
GLONASS
COSPAS-SARSAT
NNSS-Transit

TY0nfYHI.question: Which statement about Satellite Based Augmentation Systems (SBAS) is correct?

options.text: The use of SBAS improves both the accuracy and the integrity of the position of the user
The use of SBAS improves neither the integrity nor the accuracy of the position of the user, but augments the number of satellites available.
The use of SBAS improves the integrity of the position of the user but does not improve the accuracy.
The use of SBAS improves the accuracy of the position of the user but does not improve the integrity.

XOS6hz3W.question: Which statement about Satellite Based Augmentation Systems (SBAS) is correct?

options.text: The use of SBAS improves both the accuracy and the integrity of the position of the user.
The use of SBAS improves the accuracy of the position of the user but does not improve the integrity.
The use of SBAS improves the integrity of the position of the user but does not improve the accuracy.
The use of SBAS improves neither the integrity nor the accuracy of the position of the user, but augments the number of satellites available.

Y6JBLvnb.question: Which of the following statements about the GBAS is true?

options.text: Ground stations whose positions are known are compared against calculated positions from the satellites.
Satellites calculate corrections and transmit directly to aircraft within range.
Ground stations transmit corrections to satellites which then adjust their position data.
GBAS consists of at least three geostationary satellites and a network of ground stations.

Qh9WiG39.question: Which of the following, if any, is a prerequisite if a receiver of a NAVSTAR/GPS satellite navigation system is to be used in combination with a multi sensor system?

options.text: The prescribed IFR-equipment must be installed and operational
The prescribed IFR-equipment must be in working correctly and the navigation information continuously displayed
The RAIM-function of the GPS receiver must be able to monitor all prescribed navigation systems
Multi-sensor systems are not certificated for flights under IFR conditions

eDvOSCXg.question: Which of the following lists are all errors that affect the accuracy and reliability of the satellite assisted navigation system (GNSS/GPS)?

options.text: Satellite clock; satellite ephemeris; atmospheric propagation.
Satellite mutual interference; satellite ephemeris; atmospheric propagation.
Satellite mutual interference; frequency drift; satellite to ground time lag.
Satellite to ground time lag; atmospheric propagation; satellite clock.

8efnMGM6.question: With reference to which time scale do GPS satellites broadcast the PRN codes?

options.text: Satellite Vehicle GPS time
GMT
UTC
IAT

0l7W8sh9.question: With reference to which time scale do GPS satellites broadcast the PRN codes?

options.text: SV GPS time
UTC
IAT
GMT

mWzMX0iL.question: The GPS Standard Positioning Service (SPS) was originally designed to provide civilian users with a less accurate positioning capability than the Precise Positioning Service (PPS) for authorised users. What makes the SPS less accurate than the PPS? SPS...

options.text: uses one carrier wave frequency.
has NO correction for ionospheric propagation delay.
uses less accurate atomic clocks.
uses a lower resolution grid.
